sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Handwritten letter from Schenker to UE, dated April 25, 1927
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: Having gained access to the facsimile of the "Appassionata" Sonata, Schenker sends revisions to his edition.
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: Faksimile; facsimile; Abmachung; contract; letter of agreement; Korrektur; corrections; proof; Handschrift; autograph manuscript; Druckerei; printers

tei:div.tei:opener:
UE date-stamp, part-illegible / Beantwortet 26. " "
An die „Universal-Edition“!Writing of this letter is recorded in Schenker's diary at OJ 3/9, p. 3058, April 25, 1927: "An die U.-E. die Korrektur von op. 57 abgeschickt." ("To UE, the corrections to Op. 57 sent off."). Wien
tei:div.tei:p: die Beethoven-FeierBeethoven Festival: March 26, 1927 was the centenary of Beethoven's death. brachte glücklicherweise das Faksimile der „Appassionata“ (aus Paris)A facsimile edition of the autograph manuscript of the "Appassionata" Sonata, Op. 57 had recently been issued (Paris: Edition d'Art H. Piazza, [1927]). Schenker's diary records that he received it on April 5, began work on correcting the sonata against the facsimile on April 23, and completed the corrections the next day (OJ 3/9, pp. 3054, 3058). nach Wien. Nun bin ich in der Lage, unseren letzten Abmachungen zu entsprechen; ich sende die Korrektur der Sonate nach der Handschrift u. erbitte eine ehebaldigste Korrektur der Druckerei, da das Faksimile stark verbreitet ist.

tei:div.tei:opener:
UE date-stamp, part-illegible / Answered 26. " "
To Universal Edition, Vienna
tei:div.tei:p: As good luck would have it, the Beethoven Festival brought the facsimile of the "Appassionata" Sonata (from Paris) to Vienna. I am now in a position to comply with our most recent letters of agreement. I am sending you the correction of the Sonata in the light of the autograph manuscript, and request a proof as soon as possible from the printer, since the facsimile is being widely distributed.
